com.guidewire.ab.external.entity

Interface Workflow

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Editable, gw.pl.external.entity.Entity, gw.pl.external.entity.KeyableEntity, Retireable, Versionable
    Deprecated. 
    External entities are deprecated. Please use the new Java API instead.

    @Deprecated
public interface Workflow
extends Retireable, gw.pl.external.entity.Entity
    Table for workflow definitions

      Deprecated. 
      Tries to invoke a "manual trigger" in the Workflow, meaning an action initiated from outside the Workflow itself.
      void invokeTrigger(WorkflowTriggerKey triggerKey, boolean synchronous)
      Deprecated. 
      Like invokeTrigger(WorkflowTriggerKey) but with an extra parameter to control whether the trigger should be evaluated synchronously (i.e. immediately in the current bundle) or else in the background.
      boolean isTriggerAvailable(WorkflowTriggerKey triggerKey)
      Deprecated. 
      True if the given trigger is available in the Workflow; i.e. if it is OK to pass the trigger ID to the invokeTrigger method

      • advance

        void advance()
        Deprecated. 
        Handle the resuming of the Indicates to the workflow that it is okay to proceed. It is similiar to resume, except that it does nothing if the workflow is in an error state.

      • createSubFlow

        Workflow createSubFlow(Workflow type)
                       throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Deprecated. 
        Create and start a subflow. If the subflow has a common super type, the common super type's properties are copied into the new workflow.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of subflow to create.
        Returns:
        the newly created and started subflow.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException

      • createSubFlow

        Workflow createSubFlow(Workflow type,
                     java.lang.Integer version)
                       throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Deprecated. 
        Create and start a subflow of the specified version. If the subflow has a common super type, the common super type's properties are copied into the new workflow.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of subflow to create.
        version - the version
        Returns:
        the newly created and started subflow.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException

      • instantiateSubFlow

        Workflow instantiateSubFlow(Workflow type)
                            throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Deprecated. 
        Create but do not start a subflow of the specified version. After you have finished populating the properties of the workflow you should either start or startAsynchronously (with the apporpiate version if desired) If the subflow has a common super type, the common super type's properties are copied into the new workflow.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of subflow to create.
        Returns:
        the newly created subflow.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException

      • invokeTrigger

        void invokeTrigger(WorkflowTriggerKey triggerKey)
        Deprecated. 
        Tries to invoke a "manual trigger" in the Workflow, meaning an action initiated from outside the Workflow itself. In the case of an external Workflow, this will just update the "triggerInvoked" field; in the case of an internal Workflow it will set the "triggerInvoked" field and advance the workflow synchronously.

        This is equivalent to calling invokeTrigger(triggerKey, true)

        Parameters:
        triggerKey -

      • invokeTrigger

        void invokeTrigger(WorkflowTriggerKey triggerKey,
                 boolean synchronous)
        Deprecated. 
        Like invokeTrigger(WorkflowTriggerKey) but with an extra parameter to control whether the trigger should be evaluated synchronously (i.e. immediately in the current bundle) or else in the background.
        Parameters:
        triggerKey -
        synchronous - if true, executes trigger immediately; otherwise in the background

      • isTriggerAvailable

        boolean isTriggerAvailable(WorkflowTriggerKey triggerKey)
        Deprecated. 
        True if the given trigger is available in the Workflow; i.e. if it is OK to pass the trigger ID to the invokeTrigger method
        Parameters:
        triggerKey -

      • log

        WorkflowLogEntry log(java.lang.String summary,
                   java.lang.String description)
        Deprecated. 
        Logs an item of information about the Workflow. The entry is returned in case you want to set additional fields on it.
        Parameters:
        summary - a short (about 10 word max) summary of what happened
        description - a longer description, which may include details like a stack trace
        Returns:
        the log entry
